node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.title: Margarita Season: Scotch Bonnet and Grapefruit Margarita

node.text: Watch as @andybaraghani makes a sweet and refreshing margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled pineapple and mint, and lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita is quite possibly *the* drink of summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.text: Tiffanie Barriere (@thedrinkingcoach) shows us her own version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireUS. Tiffanie makes a strawberry and black peppercorn syrup for a sweet and spicy G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Black Pepper G+T

node.text: #Ad Esther Choi (@choibites), chef/owner of @mokbar_nyc, is showing us how to make a mandu stir-fry with lots of vegetables and of course, @bibigoUSA’s mandu.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 15, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: This one-pan chicken dinner by contributor Grant Melton (@grantmelton) gets two times the flavor from using both the peppers and the pickling liquid from a jar of pepperoncinis. The chicken roasts in the spicy pickling liquid, while the potatoes cook away nestled among the bright, yellow peppers. Once the potatoes are done, just toss them together with crisp, raw vegetables to get warm potato salad vibes. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich

For those who didn’t grow up eating Mexican and Tex-Mex cuisine, seeing “Mexican oregano” included in a recipe may raise a question or two. Namely, “What is Mexican oregano?” and “Can I just use any oregano instead?” Contributor Jarrett Melendez (@jamarmel) explains it all at the link in our bio. 📷: @emmafishman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 14, 2021. May be an image of dessert.

node.text: When summer gives you perfect peaches, it’s only right to turn them into a glorious peach pie. This recipe from lawyer-turned-baking-champion Vallery Lomas (@foodieinnewyork) is a labor of love, but the reward is a slice of pure sunshine. The nutmeg, vanilla, citrus juice and zest, and a splash of optional (but highly recommended) brandy all enhance that peach flavor without overpowering it. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rice.isnice

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 13, 2021. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Once you go Topo, you'll never go back. This 126-year-old mineral water is so heavily carbonated, the opening sips scour your tongue; it’s confident, intense. But it’s not only the taste that satisfies, writes @just_alexmcelroy. The true pleasure of Topo (say it with me: Toe-Poe) Chico is holding the bottle—sleek and firm, lean and willowy as a model. "Drag the glass across your forehead—there’s no better way to cool down during a steamy Texas summer." If you haven’t already tried Topo Chico, it’s time you discover what might be the worst-kept secret in mineral water. Click the link in our bio to read more. 📷: @emmafishman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 13, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and food.

node.text: Sure, pickled cucumbers are great. But have you tried pickled cauliflower? Bright with lime, vinegar, and heat from Scotch bonnet chiles, this quick pickle by chef-author-activist Bryant Terry (@bryantterry) is the ideal foil to rich dishes like these jackfruit-filled tamales. Click the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: Oriana Koren 🍴: @mrsmochi 🥣: @jjoules

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 13, 2021. May be an image of fruit, drink and indoor.

node.text: This bubbly peach sangria developed by associate food editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is one of our favorite ways to use up all those ripe, fresh stone fruits we overbought at the farmers market. It’s tangy, a little sweet, and extra fizzy, which also makes it perfect for your next outdoor party. If you’re in a pinch and can’t find perfect peaches, don't sweat: The frozen ones work surprisingly well, too. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @curlygirlcooks 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: We're big fans of grilling skin-on, boneless chicken breasts and associate editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is here to show you how it's done with a tadka-ish scallion sauce. Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 12, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Many ragus require hours of simmering—but not this one. Test kitchen director Chris Morocco (@moroccochris) hops in the express lane by opting for ground meat rather than bigger hunks, which gives you a head start on tenderness, and combining it with flavor-packed ingredients like double-concentrated tomato paste and heavy cream. Together they make for a sauce that’s just as satisfying as one that’s cooked all day. Click the link in our bio for this perfect weeknight recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 12, 2021. May be an image of drink.

node.text:
In the canon of classic tiki cocktails, the Mai Tai stands out as one of the most iconic. At its core, this booze-forward concoction is an opportunity for great rum to shine, which is why associate food editor Rachel Gurjar's (@rachelgurjar) version includes a combination of white and aged rums. The white rum is lighter bodied and fruity, while the aged rum brings juicy banana, vanilla, and burnt sugar notes to the table. Click the link in our bio to enjoy this refreshing summer cocktail. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rice.isnice
🥣: @aeswist

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 11, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Keema, a ground meat stew originating on the Indian subcontinent, is traditionally served on its own or used to stuff samosas and naan. Here, associate food editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) makes a ground lamb version that’s fragrent with onions, garlic, and spices and uses it as a taco filling. Bonus: You can use leftovers as the filling for sloppy Joe–style sandwiches for another speedy weeknight meal. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 11, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: This delicately flavored Japanese-style dish is the perfect way to showcase corn when it is in season. Contributor Hana Asbrink (@hanaasbrink) takes short-grain sushi rice with corn (including its cob!) and cooks it in water that's been infused with kombu and soy sauce, creating a sweet and savory springboard for all sorts of summer meals. The best part? You can make this easily in a rice cooker. Click the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @rice.isnice

When Zinara Rathnayake (@zin10santafe) was a child, her amma would make kola kanda, a traditional Sri Lankan herbal beverage with a porridge-like texture and a rich, herbaceous taste. But she's struggled to recreate it—until she came across Kola Goodies’s Super Green Latte. It's a powder blend of Sri Lankan kola kanda that mixes organic coconut milk powder, oat milk powder, gotu kola, moringa, and cinnamon. For Rathnayake, it’s creamy, fresh, and tastes just like a piece of home. Click the link in our bio to get this perfect morning booster. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @aeswist
